speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me a little bit about when you first started noticing these changes in your mental status - was it a sudden onset or did it develop gradually over time?

speaker: Patient
text: "It started a few days ago, I think. I just woke up one morning and felt really foggy and couldn't remember what day it was. At first, I thought it was just stress from work, but as the days went by, I just felt more and more confused, like I was stuck in a haze."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about your daily activities and routine over the past few days - have you noticed any changes in your ability to perform tasks or make decisions?

speaker: Patient
text: "I've been trying to stick to my usual routine, but it's been really tough. I've been having trouble remembering appointments and tasks, like taking my medication or picking up groceries. I feel like I'm just going through the motions, you know? I'll be doing something, like cooking dinner, and I'll forget what I was doing or why I was doing it."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about your sleep patterns? Have you noticed any changes in the amount of sleep you're getting or the quality of your sleep? speaker: Patient
text: "Oh, sleep... I've been having trouble sleeping too. I'll fall asleep okay, but then I'll wake up in the middle of the night and feel really anxious or disoriented. It's like my brain is racing, even when I'm supposed to be resting. As for my usual morning routine, I try to wake up at the same time every day, but lately, I've been having trouble remembering what day it is or what time it is. It's like my internal clock has gotten all mixed up."
